title: Just Transitions: Focusing on South Africa and India
description: This week, Chandra Bhushan with iFOREST and Jesse Burton with the University of Cape Town join Sandeep Pai (CSIS) to look at how key themes of just transitions are important in the context of CoP26 meetings.

title: Subsidies
description: In this week's column, the Scholl Chair discusses the growing problem of using subsidies as a tool of industrial policy. How do subsidies factor into China's non-market economy, overcapacity in the steel and aluminum sectors, and climate change?

title: Japan’s Lower House Election: Kishida Gets a Mandate for Now
description: Japan's ruling coalition led by the Liberal Democratic Party retained a majority in the Lower House election. The CSIS Japan Chair analyzes the results and the challenges facing Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in the coming months.

title: ISP Brief October 2021
description: It's my pleasure to send you the October 2021 edition of the ISP Brief, the monthly newsletter of the CSIS International Security Program.

title: Next Steps in Critical Infrastructure Protection: Challenges for CISA and Congress
description: CSIS hosts a discussion on how to best enhance cybersecurity for critical infrastructure with Jen Easterly, director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), and Representative John Katko of New York's 24th district.

title: Global Economics Monthly, October 2021
description: We are pleased to share the October 2021 issue of the Global Economics Monthly (GEM), the newsletter of the CSIS Economics Program.

title: G20 Is Not up to Today’s Policy Challenges
description: CSIS senior adviser Mark Sobel discusses the upcoming G20 Rome summit, which he predicts will be workmanlike, professional, and unexciting, but not up to today's challenges.

title: Short Markets and Long Transitions
description: High energy prices offer a warning to negotiators at Glasgow: an energy transition that moves too quickly could burn itself out.

title: Securing the Energy Transition
description: You are cordially invited to a conversation with Amos Hochstein, Senior Advisor for Global Energy Security at the U.S. Department of State, on energy security and the global energy transition.

title: Just Transitions in Coal Dependent Communities
description: The Just Transitions Initiative presents its forthcoming report: "Understanding Just Transitions in Coal-Dependent Communities: Case Studies from Mpumalanga, South Africa, and Jharkhand, India."

title: Population, Climate, and Conflict: New Data Point to Greater Challenges Ahead
description: What does climate change-induced migration really look like? A perfect storm of population pressures, environmental degradation, and poor governance. Here’s why the COP26 agenda will be incomplete without considering all three.

title: Korea-US Economic Alliance and Tasks To Be Advanced After the Moon Jae-in Administration
description: On Friday, October 29, CSIS and the Smart Women, Smart Power Initiative hosted a private, off-the-record roundtable with Minister Park Young-sun on the “Korea-US Economic Alliance and Tasks After the Moon Jae-in Administration.” Below is a script of her introductory remarks.
